article.title: Bass_music
article.paragraph: Forthe subgenre of hip hop musicMiami bassBass musicis an umbrella term that refers to various styles of music includingdrum and bass,Bassline (music genre)bassline,dubstepandUK garage, among others. The phrase began to be used in response to the blending of sounds between these genres. The key characteristic shared among these genres are an emphasis onbasslines,groove (music)grooveandrhythm.

In theUnited Kingdom, bass music, or UK bass has had major mainstream success since the late 2000s and early 2010s, with artists such asExample (musician)Example,Chase & Status,Skream,Benga (musician)BengaandWretch 32.cite newshttp://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2011/jun/30/example-uk-bass

DubstepproducerSkreamis quoted in an interview withThe Independentin September 2011 as saying, "The word dubstep is being used by a lot of people and there were a lot of people being tagged with the dubstep brush. They don't want to be tagged with it and shouldn't be tagged with it - that's not what they're pushing... When I say 'UK bass', it's what everyone UK is associated with so it would be a lot easier if it was called that."cite newsSkream: "I want to make sure once this fad dies out, I'm still standing"http://blogs.independent.co.uk/2011/09/13/skream-%E2%80%98i-want-to-make-sure-once-this-fad-dies-out-i%E2%80%99m-still-standing%E2%80%99/[[The Independent]]2011-09-132012-01-04LondonSamMoir
Outside of nightclubs, bass music has mainly been promoted and played on web radio stations, the most notable being Rinse.FM, Sub.FM and Rood.FM in the UK, and BassRadio.FM in the US.
